communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: VR Police (Huntington Beach Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records related to the department's procurement or purchase of VR training equipment:
- Brochures, marketing materials including videos and demonstrations, PowerPoints from VR companies
- Invoices, Contracts, and Proposals from VR companies
- Grant requests to purchase or trial VR software and hardware
- Emails related to meetings, presentations, demonstrations, or conference appointments with VR companies. 
Search 2020 to 2024

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Joey Scott

communications.subject: Police Records Request :: P024236-040125
communications.communication:
Dear Joey : 

Thank you for contacting the Huntington Beach Police Department to obtain public records. 

The police department received your Public Records Act request dated April 01, 2025 and has assigned the reference number P024236-040125 for tracking purposes. 

Record(s) Requested: To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records related to the department's procurement or purchase of VR training equipment:
- Brochures, marketing materials including videos and demonstrations, PowerPoints from VR companies
- Invoices, Contracts, and Proposals from VR companies
- Grant requests to purchase or trial VR software and hardware
- Emails related to meetings, presentations, demonstrations, or conference appointments with VR companies.
Search 2020 to 2024

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Joey Scott

communications.subject: [Records Center] Welcome to the Records Center!
communications.communication:
Dear Joey , Thank you for registering with the City of Huntington Beach Public Records Center. If you have never used this system, your account has been created by a staff person at the City of Huntington Beach. Once your email address has been verified, you can log in to the Public Records Center to update any contact or password information and to track the progress of your request. Login: 184251-84955738@requests.muckrock.com 
To verify your email address, the following activation link to set a password will be active for 24 hours. Activate Online Account (https://huntingtonbeachca.mycusthelp.com/WEBAPP//_rs/ChangePassword.aspx?cuEmail=wYgOSSmCetm1KCjZuHnQdI+I53SgDU1b5ta7nb4BFIu8SxJcwFYweJafqz/vp79Vl7IVV0uVwzRR+8FjJCJunhr+NdUhJrUT8c/ovW0QIkM=&expire=/vKnLP7LpxFuvoO+89QGP06msC3cAmlVHmWmX39iM9eyBnp8lEHbgvNHbCOOwjc+) 
If the activation link expires, you will need to request a password by clicking the link below. This will allow you to access your request, manage account information, and retrieve responsive records. Request a Password (https://huntingtonbeachca.mycusthelp.com/WEBAPP/_rs/ForgotPassword.aspx) 
Thank you, City of Huntington Beach 
  
 This is an auto-generated email and has originated from an unmonitored email account. Please DO NOT REPLY.

communications.subject: [Records Center] City Records Request :: P024236-040125
communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 

    
 
  
 
RE: Public Records Reference # P024236-040125 
Dear Joey: 
This email is in response to your California Public Records Act request dated April 01, 2025 wherein you requested documents relating to "VR companies." 
The City needs additional clarification regarding your request.  Please provide the complete business name so that we can search for the requested documents. 
A reply must be received within five (5) business days of the date this email was sent or your request will be closed and a new request will be required. 
If you have any questions, please reply to this email. 
Thank you, 
Finance Department
